docs.snippet: PARIS, Dec. 6--The United States suffered its first major setback at this session of the United Nations General Assembly this morning when Greece, the United States candidate, was unable to win election to the Security Council as the successor to...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Dec. 6--The United States suffered its first major setback at this session of the United Nations General Assembly this morning when Greece, the United States candidate, was unable to win election to the Security Council as the successor to Yugoslavia.
docs.abstract: Assembly deadlocked over Yugoslav replacement; Byelorussia leads despite US backing for Greece; backed by Latin-Amer reprs, GB and France; further voting postponed; Pakistan and Chile elected

headline.main: BYELORUSSIA LEADS U.S. CHOICE IN VOTE FOR SECURITY SEAT; Soviet-Bloc Nation in 8-Ballot Deadlock With Greece--Final Decision Delayed--PAKISTAN, CHILE ELECTED--Some Latins Decline to Back Athens in Retaliation for Rebuff on Court Post

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTON Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: PARIS, Dec. 6--The United States and several small powers introduced a resolution in the United Nations General Assembly today that would censure the Union of South Africa for its policy regarding the neighboring territory of South-West Africa, a...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Dec. 6--The United States and several small powers introduced a resolution in the United Nations General Assembly today that would censure the Union of South Africa for its policy regarding the neighboring territory of South-West Africa, a former League of Nations mandate.

headline.main: U.N. REBUKE URGED FOR SOUTH AFRICA; U.S., 7 More Lands Sponsor Motion Attacking Policy in South-West Territory

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: A chance to spend both Christmas and New Year's on the high seas under tropical skies while cruising down to Rio will be offered to travelers on a twentythree-day holiday cruise of the Moore-McCormack liners Argentina and Uruguay, the line announced...
docs.lead_paragraph: A chance to spend both Christmas and New Year's on the high seas under tropical skies while cruising down to Rio will be offered to travelers on a twentythree-day holiday cruise of the Moore-McCormack liners Argentina and Uruguay, the line announced yesterday.
docs.abstract: tanker launched for Union Oil, Sparrows Pt; Calif boy who won essay contest attends ceremony

headline.main: EVENTS OF INTEREST IN SHIPPING WORLD; Moore-McCormack Line Offers Christmas-New Year's Trip Using 2 of Its Ships

docs.snippet: An order limiting the use of sulphur and sulphuric acid in certain industries will be announced next week, with Jan. 1 as the effective date, it was learned yesterday from industry sources.  Such an order was prepared to go into effect in November,...
docs.lead_paragraph: An order limiting the use of sulphur and sulphuric acid in certain industries will be announced next week, with Jan. 1 as the effective date, it was learned yesterday from industry sources. Such an order was prepared to go into effect in November, but it was withdrawn.

headline.main: Order Limiting Uses of sulphur In Industry Expected Next Week; Shortage Called Continuing

docs.snippet: Assembly sets another vote; Athens weighs withdrawing
docs.abstract: Assembly sets another vote; Athens weighs withdrawing

headline.main: U.N. VOTES TOMORROW ON SEAT IN COUNCIL

docs.snippet: PARIS, Dec. 12 The United Nations General Assembly will make another attempt tomorrow to elect a successor to Yugoslavia on the Security Council. Greece, the United States candidate, is believed to have a 50-50 chance to defeat Byelorussia.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Dec. 12 The United Nations General Assembly will make another attempt tomorrow to elect a successor to Yugoslavia on the Security Council. Greece, the United States candidate, is believed to have a 50-50 chance to defeat Byelorussia.

headline.main: U. N. RENEWS VOTE FOR COUNCIL TODAY; Greece Is Now Given an Even Chance Against Byelorussia for Security Unit Seat

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTON Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The 134 young men who completed yesterday their studies at the United States Merchant Marine Academy at Kings Point, L.I., are fortunate in that their entrance into the maritime industry comes at a time when there is an almost desperate need for...
docs.lead_paragraph: The 134 young men who completed yesterday their studies at the United States Merchant Marine Academy at Kings Point, L.I., are fortunate in that their entrance into the maritime industry comes at a time when there is an almost desperate need for trained officer personnel, Vice Admiral E.L. Cochrane, chairman of the Federal Maritime Board, said yesterday.

headline.main: EVENTS OF INTEREST IN SHIPPING WORLD; Kings Point Academy Class of 134 Gets Commissions in Merchant Marine Merchant Fleet Increased by 40 Israeli Ship Strike in Third Day
